Key Match Events: Daz Cameron, Max Schuemann, and Nick Allen parlayed successive bunts into a two-run rally in the top of the 12th inning, helping the Oakland Athletics escape with a 4-3 win over the Houston Astros.
Jose Altuve opened the bottom of the 12th with an RBI double that scored automatic runner Jason Heyward.
Pinch hitter Jon Singleton sliced the deficit in half with his first career triple, bringing home Ben Gamel.
Shea Langeliers hit a sacrifice fly to left that plated Brent Rooker for a 1-0 lead.
Zack Gelof hit a 416-foot blast to left field on the first pitch of the second inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Oakland left-hander JP Sears had his start bumped up one day after scheduled starter Osvaldo Bido was placed on the 15-day injured list with right wrist flexor tendinitis.
